meanings.definition: The quality of being easily quotable or able to be quoted.
meanings.sent1: Her speech had such quotability that everyone was repeating her words.
meanings.sent2: The quotability of the famous movie lines made them instantly recognizable.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about the quotability of his own jokes, saying they were too good to forget.
meanings.sent4: The quotability of the novel's opening line made it a classic for generations to come.
meanings.sent5: The teacher emphasized the importance of quotability in academic writing to make ideas memorable.

meanings.definition: The extent to which something is suitable for being quoted.
meanings.sent1: The quotability of the research findings made them perfect for the article.
meanings.sent2: Journalists often look for quotability in interviews to make their articles more engaging.
meanings.sent3: The politician's quotability in speeches made him a favorite among voters.
meanings.sent4: The quotability of the CEO's statements in the press conference caused a stir in the business world.
meanings.sent5: The professor highlighted the importance of quotability in academic discussions for clarity and understanding.
